title: Moody's beats profit and revenue estimates
text:
Moody's Corp. MCO, +1.90% said its profit rose for its third quarter as revenue increased about 15% from a year earlier.

The New York-based debt-rating company reported a profit of $379.4 million, or $1.99 a share, compared with $310.2 million, or $1.59 a share, a year ago.

The company posted an adjusted profit of $2.15 a share. Analysts polled by FactSet were expecting earnings of $1.87 a share, or $1.99 a share on an adjusted basis.

Revenue rose to $1.24 billion from $1.08 billion a year earlier. Analysts had expected $1.18 billion of revenue in the quarter.

The company said its investors service unit benefited from stronger corporate and public finance sector bond issuance amid favorable market conditions.

Revenue in its analytics division, which provides research and data analysis, rose 13% to $494 million. Revenue for Moody's Investors Service rose 16% to $747 million, compared with a 10% increase in overall debt issuance activity.
